Actions.Text: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

Title: Requires additional notice prior to commencing an action in certain discrimination cases
Summary: Requires that a claimant alleging that the contents of a website or mobile application that describes goods and services provided at a place of public accommodation constitutes an unlawful discriminatory practice against visually and hearing impaired individuals serve written notice on the owner and provide 60 days to cure the alleged violation prior to commencing an action.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to requiring additional notice prior to commencing an action in certain discrimination cases
